title: What should I do if my SIM card has been cloned? - Quora

response.answer_text: Report what you know or whatever you suspect to the Service Provider. They will send a Disable request to the Telecommunications software for your old SIM card that was suspected to be a clone, and Disallow it from accessing the tower to make a call. Request for a new SIM card, with your original Identity card or Passport.Some Service Providers will issue new SIM cards on Gratis or Free of Charge, while others may levy an administrative fee.It is important to get replacement quickly.

Contact your phone company IMMEDIATELY. Explain to them your suspicion that your SIM card has been cloned and, disregarding if it indeed has been cloned or not, request a new substitute SIM card. You may have to pay a little fee for this new SIM. Your number will be migrated to the new SIM, and the old one will become useless trash...as well as the cloned-one in consequence. DO it NOW !... stop waiting for more answers to your question in Quora ! Good luck !
